title: N03-1026

sentences.text: We present an application of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques for Lexical-Functional Grammars -LRB- LFG -RRB- to the domain of sentence condensation .

Our system incorporates a linguistic parser/generator for LFG , a transfer component for parse reduction operating on packed parse forests , and a maximum-entropy model for stochastic output selection .
Furthermore , we propose the use of standard parser evaluation methods for automatically evaluating the summarization quality of sentence condensation systems .
An experimental evaluation of summarization quality shows a close correlation between the automatic parse-based evaluation and a manual evaluation of generated strings .
Overall summarization quality of the proposed system is state-of-the-art , with guaranteed grammaticality of the system output due to the use of a constraint-based parser/generator .

summary: We present an application of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques for Lexical-Functional Grammars -LRB- LFG -RRB- to the domain of sentence condensation . Our system incorporates a linguistic parser/generator for LFG , a transfer component for parse reduction operating on packed parse forests , and a maximum-entropy model for stochastic output selection . Furthermore , we propose the use of standard parser evaluation methods for automatically evaluating the summarization quality of sentence condensation systems . An experimental evaluation of summarization quality shows a close correlation between the automatic parse-based evaluation and a manual evaluation of generated strings . Overall summarization quality of the proposed system is state-of-the-art , with guaranteed grammaticality of the system output due to the use of a constraint-based parser/generator .

Predicate-apply.label: apply
Predicate-apply.description: To apply refers to the act of putting a concept or method into practice, often with the intention of solving a problem, achieving an outcome, or improving a situation. This predicate connects the subject (the entity performing the action) and object (the thing being applied), indicating that the subject is actively utilizing or implementing the object in order to accomplish something.

Predicate-incorporates.label: incorporates
Predicate-incorporates.description: The predicate 'incorporates' indicates that the subject has integrated or combined with something to form a new whole. This integration can be conceptual, functional, or structural, and implies a sense of unity or cohesion between the subject and object.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: To evaluate means to assess or judge the value, worthiness, or significance of something based on certain criteria or standards. The subject performs this assessment by examining and analyzing the object, which can be a concept, idea, quality, performance, or outcome.

Predicate-correlates_with.label: correlates with
Predicate-correlates_with.description: Indicates a relationship where two entities or methods are connected by sharing similar characteristics, patterns, or trends. The subject and object are linked through their correlation, suggesting that they exhibit comparable properties or behaviors.

Predicate-is_state-of-the-art.label: is state-of-the-art
Predicate-is_state-of-the-art.description: The predicate 'is state-of-the-art' indicates that the subject has reached a level of excellence or innovation in its field, making it the most advanced or up-to-date among others. It implies a comparison with other entities or approaches, suggesting that the subject is currently at the forefront of development and achievement.

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates a deliberate act of making something available, introducing or showcasing an idea, concept, or work. It implies that the subject has taken some action to bring forth or reveal the object, which can be a physical entity, an abstract notion, or even an intellectual contribution.

Predicate-applies.label: applies
Predicate-applies.description: The predicate 'applies' indicates that a set of techniques, methods or principles (subject) are being used in a specific context or domain to achieve a particular goal or effect (object).

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a more specific instance of the object concept. In other words, it establishes an is-a relationship between the two concepts, where the subject is a narrower or more specialized version of the object.
